page.title: 13Landscape.
page.content: Walking down a quiet 180 metres long farm track near the southern boundary of our block we saw many colourful wild flowers.The most common flower was the foxglove,the tallest found measured 181cm.The hawthorn trees were in full flower and very attractive. The gorse bushes were covered in yellow flowers and very popular with the bees.As the hedges were overgrown the wild rose flowers were numerous and pink and white in colour.Another popular plant was the hawkweed with its long tough stem.The delicate speedwell peeped among the grass,while the stonecrop made splashes of yellow. In our part of the world the pink campion is very common and we saw many on our walk.Due to a late spring there were still a few brave bluebells to be seen however most had gone to seed.
